name: Wilson and Associates Coaching and Consulting
description: A Black-owned, woman-led firm specializing in DEI and organizational change, culture transformation, and leadership development. They partner with organizations to build inclusive cultures
services: African-American-owned Inclusion training in Connecticut consultation

name: Connecticut Diversity Council (CTDC)
description: Offers training and resources on diversity, equity, and inclusion for professionals across various sectors. They emphasize the business case for DEI and integrating it into organizational strategy
services: African-American-owned Inclusion training in Connecticut consultation

name: Central Connecticut State University (CCSU) - Office of Professional Education
description: Offers a "Diversity & Inclusion Essentials" web-based certificate program, providing training on DEI concepts and building a robust DEI approach in the workplace
services: African-American-owned Inclusion training in Connecticut consultation

name: CREC Resource Group
description: Provides customized DEI training, professional learning series, and collaborative sessions for schools, districts, and organizations across Connecticut. They focus on research-based strategies and equity initiatives
services: African-American-owned Inclusion training in Connecticut consultation

name: ExecMommyGroup
description: Founded by Joelle Murchison, this organization provides diversity and inclusion consulting and workshops, focusing on recognizing personal biases and promoting DEI
services: African-American-owned Inclusion training in Connecticut consultation

name: Business Training Works, Inc.
description: Offers a wide range of onsite and virtual training courses in Connecticut, including diversity and inclusion training, tailored to business needs
services: African-American-owned Inclusion training in Connecticut consultation

name: Connecticut Small Business Development Center (SBDC)
description: While not exclusively focused on DEI training, the SBDC provides business advice, counseling, seminars, and workshops throughout Connecticut, which can include topics relevant to business growth and development for all entrepreneurs, including minority-owned businesses
services: African-American-owned Inclusion training in Connecticut consultation

name: Building Black Business CT
description: This initiative provides resources and education to help Black entrepreneurs start and grow businesses in Connecticut. While not direct DEI training, it supports the growth of Black-owned businesses, which is a component of DEI
services: African-American-owned Inclusion training in Connecticut consultation

name: CT.gov - Black-owned Business Resources
description: The state of Connecticut provides resources for Black-owned businesses, including information on training, mentorship, and programs that promote diversity and inclusivity in business
services: African-American-owned Inclusion training in Connecticut consultation

name: ShopBlackCT
description: A directory of Black-owned businesses in Connecticut. While not a training provider itself, it serves as a valuable resource for identifying and supporting Black-owned businesses, contributing to economic diversity
services: African-American-owned Inclusion training in Connecticut consultation
